main event: A pilot spotted a cigar-shaped brown object that followed an erratic path and disappeared abruptly over Riverside, California on February 19, 1956.
interesting points: The pilot initially believed the object was an optical illusion caused by old shaped contrails.
The object had a distinct color and well-defined shape, and suddenly caused a continued oscillation.
The object made a sudden, sharp turn away before disappearing.
There were five known aircraft in the area leaving contrails at the time of the sighting.
The sighting lasted for about 8 minutes.
result: Inconclusive, possibly a balloon or aircraft
photographs: No photographs included in the report
